result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Baily S. KREIE

records.addlTxt:
Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on 02-05-2016 .
Original transcript is on file in case no: 15CF159.
Copy of transcript mailed to Registrar at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.

Defendant in custody.   
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered pleas in Case Files 15 CF 755, 15 CF 612, 15 CF 159, 15 CF 124 and 14 CM 410.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 03-17-2016 at 10:30 a.m., Br. 1.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 12-22-15 at 10:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody on another matter.
Case riding along with 15 CF 612 set for settlement conference with DA on 12-10-15 at 9:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.   
Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Preliminary hearing on 15 CF 612 set for 11-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-09-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on other matters.
Minutes.
